TunableTuple.name: CHEST_OPEN_INTEARCTION
TunableTuple.description: A reference to the open interaction for chests. This interaction will be listened for to determine temple completion.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: The Sim must have started either any affordance in this list or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either an interaction matching one of these Tags or an affordance from the list of Affordances in this tunable.

Tunable.name: CHEST_OPEN_STATE
Tunable.description: The state that indicates the chest is open.

TunableEnum.name: CHEST_TAG
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to identify the final chest of a temple. If it's in the open state, the temple will be considered solved.

TunableTuple.name: GATE_LOCK_LOOT
TunableTuple.description: The LockDoor loot to run on the gates in the temple on load when they should be locked.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: clear_existing_locks
TunableEnum.description: Which locks should be cleared before adding the new lock data.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_genus_exception
TunableTuple.description: Lock all Sims except those that match the tuned genus.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description: If MATCH_ALL is set, test will pass if Sim matches with all enabled tuned genus. If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass if Sim matches with one of the enabled tuned genus.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableVariant.name: species
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_simid_exception
TunableTuple.description: The lock data will reject anyone who's not in the exception sim id list.

Tunable.name: except_actor
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have this actor as exception sim.

Tunable.name: except_household
Tunable.description: If we want this lock data to have actor's household as exception sims.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: lock_all_with_situation_job_exception
TunableTuple.display: Lock All With Situation Job Exception

Tunable.name: except_business_employee
Tunable.description: If true, the business store employee will have exception to the door.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to determine whether this sim can pass or not.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation job test.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableList.name: creature_types
TunableList.description: The creature types that this lock data applies to.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

TunableTuple.name: lock_ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description: The lock data represent ranked statistic test. Sim that can pass the the ranked statistic test on the data can pass this lock.

TunableEnum.name: lock_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this lock data. Used in comparison between multiple lock datas on the lock component test.

TunableEnum.name: lock_sides
TunableEnum.description: Which side or both this lock data will lock.

TunableTuple.name: rank_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Sims that have ranked statistic's value inside the threshold are not locked by the portal.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold.

Tunable.name: ranked_stat
Tunable.description: The ranked statistic we are operating on. Sims won't be allowed to traverse if they don't have this statistic.

Tunable.name: should_persist
Tunable.description: If checked, this lock data will be persisted.

Tunable.name: replace_same_lock_type
Tunable.description: If True, it will replace the same type of lock data in the locking component, otherwise it will update the existing data.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: target_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: As subject filter tests, except per target object. See description of subject filter tests.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The object to lock.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

Tunable.name: GATE_STATE
Tunable.description: The state for temple gates. Used for easy look up.

TunableEnum.name: GATE_TAG
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to find the gate objects inside Temples.

TunableTuple.name: GATE_UNLOCK_LOOT
TunableTuple.description: The UnlockDoor loot to run on the gates when they should be unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: chance
TunableTuple.description: Percent chance that the loot action will be considered. The chance is evaluated just before running the tests.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The sim(s) the operation is applied to.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: target_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: As subject filter tests, except per target object. See description of subject filter tests.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The object to unlock.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_creature_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define the creature types that for which this unlock will apply

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of creature types to apply the unlock to if LockType is LOCK_CREATURE.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of the lock we want to remove, by default should be everything.

Tunable.name: GATE_UNLOCK_STATE
Tunable.description: The unlock state for temple gates.

Tunable.name: TEMPLE_LOT_DESCRIPTION
Tunable.description: A reference to the lot description file for the temple lot. This is used for easier zone ID lookups.

TunableList.name: TEMPLES
TunableList.description: A Mapping of Temple Templates (house descriptions) and the data associated with each temple.

TunableTuple.name: Temple Data
TunableTuple.description: The data associated with the mapped temple template.

TunableList.name: enter_lot_loot
TunableList.description: Loot applied to Sims when they enter or spawn in to this Temple. NOTE: Exit Lot Loot is not guaranteed to be given. For example, if the Sim walks onto the lot, player switches to a different zone, then summons that Sim, that Sim will bypass getting the exit loot.

TunableList.name: exit_lot_loot
TunableList.description: Loot applied to Sims when they exit or spawn out of this Temple. NOTE: This loot is not guaranteed to be given after Enter Lot Loot. For example, if the Sim walks onto the lot, player switches to a different zone, then summons that Sim, that Sim will bypass getting the exit loot.

TunableList.name: rooms
TunableList.description: A mapping of room number to the room data. Room number 0 will be the entrance room to the temple, room 1 will be the first room that needs to be unlocked, and so on.

Tunable.name: Room Data
Tunable.description: A reference to a Templeroomdata tuning snippet.

TunableEnum.name: TRAP_TAG
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to identify traps inside temples. This will be used to find placeholder traps as well.
